meanings.definition: To make something smaller in size or scale.
meanings.sent1: I need to downsize my wardrobe to fit all my clothes in the closet.
meanings.sent2: The company had to downsize the packaging to reduce costs.
meanings.sent3: I tried to downsize my suitcase, but I still couldn't close it.
meanings.sent4: She decided to downsize her collection of books to make more space in the room.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to downsize the portions to ensure everyone got a taste of the dish.

meanings.definition: To reduce the number of employees in a company.
meanings.sent1: The company had to downsize due to financial difficulties.
meanings.sent2: They had to downsize the workforce to stay afloat.
meanings.sent3: After the merger, they had to downsize the staff, which led to some changes.
meanings.sent4: The decision to downsize the team was a tough one for the management.
meanings.sent5: The company had no choice but to downsize in order to survive in the market.

meanings.definition: To simplify or streamline a process or operation.
meanings.sent1: We need to downsize the steps in the procedure to make it more efficient.
meanings.sent2: The new software will help us downsize the manual tasks.
meanings.sent3: I tried to downsize the meeting agenda, but it still took hours.
meanings.sent4: The goal is to downsize the production process without compromising quality.
meanings.sent5: The team brainstormed ideas to downsize the project timeline for better results.
